metadata.title: CVE-2021-3682 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the USB redirector device emulation of QEMU in versionsprior to 6.1.0-rc2. It occurs when dropping packets during a bulk transferfrom a SPICE client due to the packet queue being full. A malicious SPICEclient could use this flaw to make QEMU call free() with faked heap chunkmetadata, resulting in a crash of QEMU or potential code execution with theprivileges of the QEMU process on the host.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
